results.title: Don't give up on me
results.brief_description: A look at the child abuse problem from the desperate parents’ point of view. Barbara, a mother of two small children, is accused of abusive behaviour and in danger of having her baby taken from her by the courts. We see Barbara’s State-assigned case worker, struggling to help the distraught mother come to grips with her problem. An adapted case history which uses scenes from an actual counselling workshop for child abuse parents.

results.title: Doing business in Japan
results.creator_credit: Business Council for International Understanding and Vision Associates
results.brief_description: This film deals with the difficulties and complications that arise, in international business relationships, as a result of the cultural barriers that exist. The film is designed to be a teaching/training tool that can be used as the focus of a discussion or course of study.

results.title: Doin' what the crowd does
results.creator_credit: Peter Wallach, Jane Warrenbrand, Peter Wallach Enterprises and Scott Newman Foundation
results.brief_description: This uniquely animated musical film tells us that teenagers don’t necessarily have to follow the crowd, but can think and act for themselves. Exuberant young people dance, sing and perform athletic stunts on a city playground. Within the dance two peer groups interact, one enticing with drugs, alcohol and cigarettes, the other “doing what’s right for me”. The film is open-ended to provoke wide ranging discussion from the audience.

results.brief_description: Features Stanley Crick (Australian Cinema pioneer in the role of Lord Mayor of Sydney 1940-42) and Peter Mullens, decathlon athlete. Narrated by Howard Craven.

results.title: Divorce and young people
results.creator_credit: Nick Vincent and Golden Coast Film Productions
results.brief_description: Depicts some of the most common fears, conflicts and problems that children face when their parents are going through divorce and demonstrates certain methods of coping with the various emotions that arise. Offers solutions to the problems that children find most difficult to solve in a divorce situation.

results.title: Divorce
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
Examines the impact of divorce on both children and adults. Uses the case study of a fictional family to show the problems, adjustments, and critical issues involved when couples decide to get a divorce.

results.title: Step family
results.creator_credit: Ronald Floethe, Centron and Gordon-Kerckhoff Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
The third in a series of transitions in family life, this episode looks at the adjustments necessary to integrating new family members and the effect that this has on the separated parent.

results.title: The Single parent family
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Family Life Transitions in Marriage”.
Examines the adjustments that children and parents must make after a divorce. Follows the case of a fictional couple whose divorce results in the woman having to face the problems and issues of single parenthood.
